intro: Elytranthe pseudoperfoliata, commonly known as the false perfoliate, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and slender, branching stems that bear small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are often mistaken for those of the true perfoliate due to their similar appearance. Elytranthe pseudoperfoliata is typically found in moist, shady environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
